text: The Flapnose sea catfish (Sciades dowii), also known as the Brown sea catfish,Common names of Sciades dowii at www.fishbase.org. is a species of catfish in the family Ariidae. It was described by Theodore Gill in 1863, originally under the genus Leptarius. It inhabits rivers and estuaries in Ecuador, Colombia, Guatemala, Costa Rica, El Salvador, Panama, Honduras, Nicaragua, Mexico, and Peru. It dwells at a depth range of .Sciades dowii at the IUCN redlist. It reaches a maximum total length of , more commonly reaching a TL of . The diet of the flapnose sea catfish includes small finfish, fish scales, and benthic invertebrates.Food items reported for Sciades dowii at www.fishbase.org. Due to a lack of known major threats to the species, it is currently ranked as Least Concern by the IUCN redlist. It has been harvested for its meat since Pre-Columbian times, and remains a commercially important foodfish to date. It is marketed both fresh and dried- salted. ==References== Category:Ariidae Category:Fish described in 1863
title: Flapnose sea catfish
